question:
With reference to the recent calls to open up the Khokhrapar border, consider the following statements:
  1. It lies between India and Pakistan.
  2. The Hinglaj Mandir is located in Rajasthan.
Which of the above statements is/are true?
explanation: Statement 1 is correct: The Khokhrapar- Munabao border lies between India and Pakistan. It is a part of the western border. After the opening up of the Kartarpur corridor, there have been calls to open this frontier up for religious pilgrimage between the two countries.  Statement 2 is incorrect: The Hinglaj Mandir is in Balochistan province in Pakistan. The opening up of the Khokhrapar border will allow the Hindu pilgrims from India to access this temple and also the followers of Saint Moinuddin Chishti in Pakistan will be able to visit the Dargah Ajmer Sharif. The Dargah is located in India’s Rajasthan.
